Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Puppy \Pup"py\, v. i. [imp. & p. p. {Puppied}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Puppying}.] To bring forth whelps; to pup. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Puppy \Pup"py\, n.; pl. {Puppies}. [F. poup['e]e doll, puppet. See {Puppet}, and cf. {Pup}, n.] 1. (Zo["o]l.) The young of a canine animal, esp. of the common dog; a whelp. [1913 Webster]
2. A name of contemptuous reproach for a conceited and impertinent person. [1913 Webster]
I found my place taken by an ill-bred, awkward puppy with a money bag under each arm. --Addison. [1913 Webster]
puppy n 1: young dog 2: an inexperienced young person [syn: {pup}]
